problem_text: "Stranger Things" is a popular Netflix show. If a Netflix show is popular, Karen will binge-watch it. If and only if Karen binge-watches a Netflix show, she will download it. Karen does not download "Black Mirror". "Black Mirror" is a Netflix show. If Karen binge-watches a Netflix show, she will share it to Lisa.
predicates:
Show(x) ::: x is a show.
NetflixShow(x) ::: x is a Netflix show.
Popular(x) ::: x is popular.
BingeWatch(x, y) ::: x binge-watches y.
Download(x, y) ::: x downloads y.
Share(x, y, z) ::: x shares y to z.
Is(x, y) ::: x is y.

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Karen binge-watches "Stranger Things" and shares it to Lisa.
tests.conclusions: BingeWatch(karen, strangerThings) ∧ Share(karen, strangerThings, lisa) ::: Karen binge-watches "Stranger Things" and shares it to Lisa. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Karen shares "Stranger Things" to Lisa and downloads "Stranger Things".
tests.conclusions: Share(karen, stranger_things, lisa) ∧ Download(karen, stranger_things) ::: Karen shares "Stranger Things" to Lisa and downloads "Stranger Things". FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Karen downloads "Stranger Things" if and only if she shares "Stranger Things" to Lisa.
tests.conclusions: Download(karen, strangerThings) ↔ Share(karen, strangerThings, lisa) ::: FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Karen downloads a Netflix show if and only if she shares it to Lisa.
tests.conclusions: Download(karen, strangerThings) ↔ Share(karen, strangerThings, lisa) ::: Karen downloads "Stranger Things" if and only if she shares "Stranger Things" to Lisa. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Karen binge-watches "Black Mirror" and downloads "Black Mirror".
tests.conclusions: BingeWatch(karen, blackMirror) ∧ Download(karen, blackMirror) ::: Karen binge-watches "Black Mirror" and downloads "Black Mirror". FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Karen downloads "Stranger Things" or Karen binge-watches "Black Mirror".
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Karen shares "Stranger Things" to Lisa.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Karen binge-watches "Stranger Things" and Karen shares "Stranger Things" to Lisa.
tests.conclusions: BingeWatch(karen, strangerThings) ∧ Share(karen, strangerThings, lisa) ::: TRUE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Karen downloads "Stranger Things", then Karen binge-watches "Stranger Things".
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Karen shares "Stranger Things" to Lisa if and only if Karen downloads "Stranger Things".
tests.conclusions: Share(karen, stranger_things, lisa) ↔ Download(karen, stranger_things) ::: FALSE

candidate_solutions.text:
# Predicates:
Show(x) ::: x is a show.
NetflixShow(x) ::: x is a Netflix show.
Popular(x) ::: x is popular.
BingeWatch(x, y) ::: x binge-watches y.
Download(x, y) ::: x downloads y.
Share(x, y, z) ::: x shares y to z.
Is(x, y) ::: x is y.

# Premises:
NetflixShow(strangerThings) ∧ NetflixShow(blackMirror) ::: "Stranger Things" is a popular Netflix show. "Black Mirror" is a Netflix show.
Popular(strangerThings) ::: "Stranger Things" is a popular Netflix show.
∀x (NetflixShow(x) ∧ Popular(x) → BingeWatch(karen, x)) ::: If a Netflix show is popular, Karen will binge-watch it.
∀x (NetflixShow(x) → (BingeWatch(karen, x) ↔ Download(karen, x))) ::: If and only if Karen binge-watches a Netflix show, she will download it.
¬Download(karen, blackMirror) ::: Karen does not download "Black Mirror".
∀x ∀y (NetflixShow(y) → Share(karen, y, lisa)) ::: If Karen binge-watches a Netflix show, she will share it to Lisa.

Popular(x) ::: x is popular.

Is(x, y) ::: x is y.

validation.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true, false, or uncertain? Karen will share "Stranger Things" to Lisa.
validation.conclusions: BingeWatch(karen, strangerThings) → Share(karen, strangerThings, lisa) ::: Karen will share "Stranger Things" to Lisa. true
